resources.string: Perfect for those nights when you want to get drunk on skunked Bud Light and eat church youth group pizza squares. Ambiance includes overly loud Jukebox with all your favorite late 90s hits. A destination for people who love dark bars and sticky tables.

If you hate punctuation and restraining orders, this is the place for you. Originally a 2 story building, it caught fire in 2006 and now is a one story building, one that involves late child support payments, that white van that is parked outside the front door that operates as the \'Smoking Lounge\' in winter and the pizza rolls that will give you instant acid reflux

The name functions as a reminder to patrons to bring their drug paraphernalia with them on their next visit. No problem if you forgot your coke mirror, you can use the back of the toilet because you are classy like that.
While technically not a grill, enterprising types can cobble together a \'walking taco\' of sorts with taco flavored combos, funyuns and a few dashes of bloody mary mix. Bon App√©tit
Do not expect staff to dig through the garbage to find your severed finger\, again. It was bad enough the first time. Next time watch your fingers.
Great place for kids if they don\'t have allergies to ragweed, lambs quarters or poison ivy. One splinter-filled picnic table is all you need for family fun time.

This strip of land is currently recuperating from being on local police records as an area known for prostitution and drug dealing. Now it operates as the overflow basin when the Chicsaw river overflows.
Once surrounded by the homes of the crumbling middle class, this plot of infrequently tended grass is slowly being reclaimed by the land, a great lesson in the resilience of nature.
In need of an outdoor pavilion only partially restored? This the place for you, also, marvel at the flying ant infestations sometimes known as termites
Tucked away behind a fast food conglomerate, this park is just perfect for tossing your trash. Extra points for the open tins of sardines a local cat lover leaves strewn about the place.
Delicious treats include bakery fresh breads, cookies and plenty of scones, made the old fashion way.
People line up around the block to score an ultra fancy cupcake/moonpie combination called the \'Cupie\'.
Don\'t let the name fool you, Donuts are the only menu item worth the trouble. The old standbys are here, but also the \'Cricket Delux\' complete with a dusting of crushed crickets

Offering sweets to the city since 1892, the owners are intent on serving the only four kinds of sweets available from that time. Menu items include, hardtack, one sugar cube, honeycomb with bee parts and an onion to be worn tied to the belt.
Delicious pour-over coffee with plenty of air conditioning for those who like to drink coffee on hot summer days.
Americano\'s are the house specialty. Make sure to arrive before 11 am to make sure to get a delicious \'Frookie\' before the sell out.
The chocolate crescent rolls are topped with whipped cream and sprinkles at this charming coffee/pastry shop.
The pour over here take a full five minutes. If this is offensive to you, you might be better off going to someplace that makes coffee quickly, like Casablanca Espresso Bar.
The folks here are speedy to the point of blurriness. If you need your coffee STAT, get here as soon as possible because your cup is already on the counter.
